author: SigFyg
body:
## PR Summary

There was an issue raised about the output of Split-Path -Parent. The Powershell committee said the output of the parent of a file path should trim the beginning back/forwardslashes.

For example:
Split-Path \\server1\abc
server1

I added a TrimStart() method in Split-Path to achieve this.

comments.author: TylerLeonhardt
comments.body:
Although this one is closed... I spoke to @SteveL-MSFT about the fact that the parameters are named:

`-Parent` and `-Leaf`

this is really not consistent... lol

it should be `-Parent` and `-Child` or `-Root` and `-Leaf`

since we don't want to cause breaking changes... we should have a couple of parameter aliases:
`-Root` is an alias of `-Parent` and `-Child` is an alias of `-Leaf`

Here are some docs on parameter aliases... should be a simple addition:
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd878292(v=vs.85).aspx

@SigFyg since you're now kinda familiar with this portion of the code, would you like to give this a try? We're here to help!

I've opened new issue tracking this inconsistency here:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6261

title: Add TrimStart to Split-Path
